abstract: A last-gasp attempt to end the NBA lockout falters, all but ensuring that games will be lost to a labor crisis for the second time in league history.
snippet: Commissioner David Stern announced the cancellation of the rest of the preseason and said that the first two weeks of the regular season would be canceled Monday.
lead_paragraph: Commissioner David Stern announced the cancellation of the rest of the preseason and said that the first two weeks of the regular season would be canceled Monday.

headline.main: N.B.A. Is Expected to Lose Two Weeks of Regular Season
headline.print_headline: Regular-Season Games Likely to Be Lost as Bid to End Lockout Fails
headline.seo: N.B.A. Likely to Lose Games as Bid to End Lockout Fails
